item.description:
http://www.meetup.com/AfricaTravel/ca...

Trip To Africa!
November 15 ~ December 9, 2013

DrumConnection is taking a TRIP TO AFRICA! Come join us and make your reservations soon. Join us at this informational meeting where you’ll meet others who may travel with us! Find out what it’s all about! Video, discussion, refreshments. More info: http://www.triptoafrica.org

WELCOME TO GUINEA!
Study djembe and dunun drumming in Africa with masters of the craft in a true cultural and musical immersion. DrumConnection of Boston, MA is hosting an unforgettable journey to the birthplace of the djembe. In this three week trip (1 and 2 week options available) you will study drum and dance, attend festivals and celebrations, learn about the country and its people, and discover the magic that is Africa. We will be based in Simbaya Gare, a village suburb of Conakry, the capital of Guinea. We will be guests at Famoudou Konate’s compound, where we will enjoy comfortable accommodations, exquisite African food, and the hospitality of the Guinean people.

See below for more detailed information.

About DrumConnection
DrumConnection, New England's premier hand drumming school, has served the rhythmic community for over 22 years. We offer excellent djembe and dunun instruction for everyone, from private and group classes to workshops and performances. We treasure our close ties to Guinea, West Africa, and honor the teachers who have shared their music and traditions with us. In association with Famoudou Konate, Mamady Keita, "Wadaba", Sayon Camara, Fode Konate and Nansady Keita, we are pleased to bring you the rich musical heritage of Africa, the birthplace of the drum. Join us!

More information is at: http://www.triptoafrica.org

"Thank you Alan, Your great work continues to inspire, even in the face of violence and war--ESPECIALLY in the face of the darkness. Blessings to you and Fanta in 2010--may DrumConnection grow and spread the beauty of Guinean drumming far and wide!" -Tom
item.name: Africa Travel Group! Learn Drumming & Dance in Guinea!
